document_data.name: She Rings Her Bells for Me
document_data.author: [[Muraevus Ruroerlar]]
document_data.basicrefs: {{cite web| url = https://web.archive.org/web/20171021205715/http://www.candlekeep.com/library/articles/sse/sse_040506-06.htm| title = So Saith Ed Apr â€“ Jun 2006| accessdate = 28-10-2024| date = 28-10-2024}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''She Rings Her Bells for Me''''' was a ballad dedicated to a famous courtesan of [[Athkatla]], [[Tharlaskra]] of the Bells, penned by [[Muraevus Ruroerlar|Muraevus "Merrysong" Ruroerlar]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Contents: ''She Rings Her Bells for Me'' was written sometime before Muraevus' death in the late 14{{th}} century DR, immortalizing Tharlaskra for the many melodic bells that chimed with her every move, all attached to the courtesan's many piercings.
